snippet: In a new analysis of the PubMed database, misconduct was the reason for three-quarters of the retractions for which analysts could determine the cause.
abstract: Study in Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences finds that scientific misconduct is the cause of three-quarters of retractions of scientific papers, rather than honest error.
lead_paragraph: In a new analysis of the PubMed database, misconduct was the reason for three-quarters of the retractions for which analysts could determine the cause.

headline.seo: Study Finds Misconduct Widespread in Retracted Scientific Papers
headline.main: Misconduct Widespread in Retracted Science Papers, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Misconduct Widespread in Retracted Science Papers, Study Finds

keywords.value: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences
keywords.name: organizations
